source: README.md claims extracted and mapped to enforcement

claims.source_text: **Daemonless.** No background process. The binary starts, does its job, exits.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST be invoked on-demand with no background daemon process
claims.rationale: Enforced by daemonless_lifecycle test which verifies no lingering processes

claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST be installable with 'cargo install decapod && decapod init'
claims.rationale: CLI provides 'init' command; install is via cargo which is external

claims.source_text: **Agent-agnostic.** Works with Claude, Codex, Gemini, Cursor, and anything else that can shell out.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST work with any agent that can execute CLI commands
claims.rationale: Entry points exist for multiple agents; CLI is agent-agnostic

claims.source_text: **Parallel-safe.** Multiple agents, one repo, no collisions.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST support concurrent agent operations without state corruption
claims.rationale: Workspace isolation via git worktrees; broker provides serialization; chaos tests verify

claims.source_text: **Proof-gated completion.** `VERIFIED` requires passing proof-plan results, not narrative.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST require executable proof for completion, not narrative claims
claims.rationale: Workunit requires proof gates to reach VERIFIED status

claims.source_text: **Fully auditable.** Every decision, trace, and proof artifact lives in `.decapod/` as plain files.
claims.normalized_claim: All Decapod state MUST be stored as plain files in .decapod/ directory
claims.rationale: All state is file-based in .decapod/; SQLite DBs are local files

claims.source_text: **Context internalization.** Turn long documents into mountable, verifiable context adapters so agents stop re-ingesting the same 50-page spec every session.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST provide context internalization to avoid repeated document parsing
claims.rationale: Internalize plugin creates mountable context adapters with deterministic hashes

claims.source_text: State is local and durable in `.decapod/`. Context, decisions, and traces persist across sessions and stay retrievable over time. Nothing hides. Nothing phones home.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod state MUST be local and repo-native with no hidden remote state
claims.rationale: State is file-based in repo; no remote sync by default

claims.source_text: No daemon. No workflow tax. Just artifacts you can read, hash, and trust.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST NOT run as a background daemon

claims.source_text: Everything material is a file you can `cat`. No databases to query, no dashboards to check. The state *is* the directory.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST store all state as human-readable files in the repo
claims.rationale: SQLite DBs are files that can be inspected; no external services required

claims.source_text: Decapod coordinates shared state across parallel runs. No silent overwrites. No drift. Each agent gets an isolated workspace with a provenance trail.
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST provide workspace isolation to prevent concurrent agent conflicts
claims.rationale: Workspace uses git worktrees; validates against protected branches

claims.source_text: Before an agent mutates your repo, Decapod forces it to answer three questions: *What did the human actually ask for?* *What boundaries apply?* *How will we prove it's done?*
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST enforce intent clarification, boundary definition, and proof planning before mutation
claims.rationale: TODO claims enforce ownership; workunit enforces proof plans; doctor provides preflight

claims.source_text: Every Decapod operation returns one of three things: Advisory (tightens intent), Interlock (hard policy boundary), Attestation (structured proof)
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod operations MUST return typed responses: Advisory, Interlock, or Attestation
claims.rationale: RPC responses include receipt, context_capsule, allowed_next_ops, blocked_by

claims.source_text: It ships with an embedded constitution: governance docs agents receive as just-in-time context
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod MUST embed constitution docs for just-in-time context delivery
claims.rationale: Docs CLI provides embedded constitution access

claims.source_text: `VERIFIED` means every gate in the proof plan actually passed â€” not "the agent said it looks good."
claims.normalized_claim: Decapod validate MUST be the authoritative completion gate
claims.rationale: Validate runs gates and terminates boundedly; tests verify

non_guarantees.reason: This is an aspirational outcome, not a guarantee. Decapod provides tools but cannot guarantee agent behavior.

non_guarantees.text: It shapes what goes into inference without doing inference itself.
non_guarantees.reason: This describes intent but is not a testable guarantee.
